alert.note: Alert for Oldham (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Clark, southwestern Oldham and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Green Spring, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Prospect around 320 PM EDT. Barbourmeade, Bellemeade, Spring Valley and Brownsboro Farm around 325 PM EDT. Hurstbourne, Hurstbourne Acres and Briarwood around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lyndon, Plantation, Murray Hill, Moorland, Goose Creek, Broeck Pointe, Manor Creek, Rolling Hills, Langdon Place, Meadow Vale, Wildwood, Meadowbrook Farm, Ten Broeck, Whipps Millgate, Jeffersontown, Middletown, Douglass Hills, Anchorage, Worthington Hills, Coldstream, Blue Ridge Manor, Woodland Hills, Creekside and Sycamore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
